private_information: I may only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels: A, E, I
I can only move one block at a time and only if it is at the top of a stack
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate with the other agent to transform the initial block configuration into the specified target stack.

private_information: I may only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M
I can only move one block at a time and only if it is at the top of a stack
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate with the other agent to transform the initial block configuration into the specified target stack.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that achieves the target block stack configuration.

public_information: There are 13 uniquely labeled blocks: L, J, D, M, E, K, H, F, I, A, G, B, C.
Blocks are arranged into stacks on a table. Only the top block of any stack is movable at any time.
Each agent can manipulate only one top block at a time.
One agent is restricted to vowel-labeled blocks and the other to consonant-labeled blocks.
Initial stacks: Stack1 bottom-to-top: L, J, K, H, I, A, G, B, C. Stack2 bottom-to-top: D, F. Stack3 bottom-to-top: M, E.
Goal configuration: a single stack on the table bottom-to-top: M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A (M on the table, A on top).
All moves must respect the top-of-stack and single-block movement constraints.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the vowel-specialized block manipulator. Provide a clear, structured analysis of what you can observe and do. Do NOT produce PDDL. Describe (1) which blocks you are allowed to move, (2) the movement primitives you can perform (for example pick-top, put-on-top-of-block, put-on-table) subject to the single-block and top-of-stack constraints, (3) any ambiguities or missing information you need to plan, and (4) suggestions for how your actions should be named or represented for later PDDL integration.
analysis.prompt: Agent: vowel_agent. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} to produce a structured capability and observation report. State any assumptions you cannot make and list the topmost blocks you believe you could move in the initial state. Output should be a concise structured description suitable for an orchestrator to convert into PDDL.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the consonant-specialized block manipulator. Provide a clear, structured analysis of what you can observe and do. Do NOT produce PDDL. Describe (1) which blocks you are allowed to move, (2) the movement primitives you can perform (for example pick-top, put-on-top-of-block, put-on-table) subject to the single-block and top-of-stack constraints, (3) any ambiguities or missing information you need to plan, and (4) suggestions for how your actions should be named or represented for later PDDL integration.
analysis.prompt: Agent: consonant_agent. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} to produce a structured capability and observation report. State any assumptions you cannot make and list the topmost blocks you believe you could move in the initial state. Output should be a concise structured description suitable for an orchestrator to convert into PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that integrates the two agents' analyses and produces a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward planner. You must output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions distinct for each agent with clear action name prefixes (for example vowel_pick, consonant_place) and include types, predicates, and all objects. The domain must reflect the single-block-at-a-time and top-of-stack constraints and the agent-specific block access restrictions.
pddl.prompt: Use the environment public information {environment->public_information}, the vowel agent analysis {vowel_analysis}, and the consonant agent analysis {consonant_analysis}. Resolve naming ambiguities if any by documenting decisions. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that when given to FastDownward can solve the task of transforming the provided initial stacks into the target stack. Ensure the problem defines all 13 blocks and the initial on/ontable/on-top facts and the goal stack. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
